Author: .stibbits
Content: In order to use Frameworx as an MQTT gateway, do you have to create templates first?

Author: thedavidschultz
Content: By gateway, do you mean consume tag data and publish via MQTT/SpB?

Author: .stibbits
Content: Yes, I primarily use ignition edge. I was looking into Frameworx as a gateway to publish MQTT/SpB as an alternative. Having to purchase additional device connections with Ignition Edge can slow the process down a bit but, it is super simple to use.

Author: IIoT#4707
Content: GG @stibbits, you just advanced to level 4!

Author: thedavidschultz
Content: Yes, you will need to create the templates first, which include Group, Node and Device IDs.

Author: .stibbits
Content: Thanks @DavidSchultz, so Adhoc becomes a little more cumbersome.

Author: fehtmc
Content: depending on which protocols youre trying to publish data to MQTT you can publish from the TagProviders, so you would not need to really create anything, only consume them

Author: uddersnz
Content:
Just looking at FrameworX demo and it has the details listed at the bottom of this message.

So it has the standard 2 hours resettable. But demo expires after 30 days, and then nothing?

How does dev work proceed like this? Is there a dev licence, or need direct access to gateway?

What about learning via tutorials etc, still imited to 30 days?

Sorry, may be missing something obvious, but used to Ignition, and saw 30 days thing, and figured I'd better ask some questions before I went as far as downloading.

================
PLEASE NOTE: The Runtime will run for two hours and must be restarted again during your 30-day evaluation period.

The Engineering Environment will be enabled to edit projects for 30 days without time restrictions. After the 30-day evaluation period, your project will open but with limited access to the entire project (Project Information access granted).

The Runtime will not run after 30 days and if an additional access license is needed, please contact: Dave Hellyer.

Author: IIoT#4707
Content: GG @Duncan Thomson, you just advanced to level 6!

Author: uddersnz
Content:
Also, are there any plans for more mentorship Tatsoft-love? 
Or do more of us need to get on and do our stage 1 practicals to make stage 2 a worthwhile endeavour?

Author: sherylmccrary
Content: @DaveHellyer(Tatsoft) perhaps you can help here?

Author: sherylmccrary
Content: Yes and yes. Definitely incorporating Tatsoft into Mentorship training curriculum plans, and Tatsoft specific modules. And you do need to do Step 1/stage 1 practical to benefit as Step 2 will build on it. The concepts taught --- UNS construction--- are applicable regardless of the platform.

Author: uddersnz

Good news, thanks @SherylM. Yes, I've been in the mentorship for a couple of years now, and have completed all the compulsory coursework, just haven't had time to get the practical done yet.
FrameworX is starting to look like an interesting prospect for my current job, so thought I'd check if we had stuff coming up. Thanks for the reply!

Author: mparris
Content:
You mentioned the unlimited, free engineering tool/environment. 

What does this mean for me wanting to build out a solution?  Am I able to run the solution I developed for free as a trial, it is the idea that I can only build the logic offline for free?

Author: davehellyer
Content:
It means you have the complete development software to build however many of any level solution from Edge to Enterprise with everything the FrameworX platform offers, completely free.  You can even run those solutions for up to two hours before it shuts down.

Next week TATSOFT is hosting instructor-led training Monday- Wednesday mornings from 8:00 AM until noon.  TATSOFT founder and CTO Marc Taccolini will personally be conducting the training.  

What‚Äôs it like to have Marc train you?  Ask Walker!

Author: enlace3444
Content:
Clear Picture SA Framework

Hey everyone ‚Äî I‚Äôve been working on a new framework to improve industrial dashboards using principles from Situation Awareness (SA).

Just published the first platform test:
üîé ‚ÄúInformation Timeliness‚Äù in FrameworX
üåê https://framework.clearpicturesa.com/sa-principles/information-timeliness#framewor-x-supports-information-timeliness

The idea is to evaluate real-world dashboard capabilities ‚Äî principle by principle ‚Äî across platforms. Would love your thoughts, especially if you work with FrameworX or interested about dashboard clarity.

Open to feedback, suggestions, or conversation.
Thanks!

Author: enlace3444
Content:
Hi everyone ‚Äî continuing to explore how Situation Awareness (SA) principles can improve industrial dashboard design.

Just wrapped up a test on how FrameworX supports the Deviation principle ‚Äî helping operators/management see when key metrics are off-target.

üìä Example: ‚ÄúActual vs Target‚Äù deviation bars in FrameworX
üåê https://framework.clearpicturesa.com/sa-principles/deviation

This is part of a series where I‚Äôm experimenting with real-world dashboard techniques ‚Äî one principle at a time ‚Äî and testing how well different tools support them.

Would love to hear your feedback, experiences, or critiques.

Author: enlace3444
Content:
Hi everyone ‚Äî continuing my exploration into how Situation Awareness (SA) principles can improve industrial dashboards.

Just wrapped up a second Deviation test using FrameworX ‚Äî this time focused not on how far values are from target, but how long they've been out of limits.

‚è±Ô∏è Duration of deviation
üìç Timestamp when the issue started
üìâ Markers that appear automatically when a value drifts out of range

These time-based indicators help operators spot persistent issues and make smarter, faster decisions.

You can see the test visuals and implementation notes here:
üåê https://framework.clearpicturesa.com/sa-principles/deviation#framewor-x-supports-deviation-duration-limits

Would love to hear any thoughts or comments ‚Äî how do you currently visualize duration of abnormal conditions in your dashboards?

Author: enlace3444
Content: Picture of the visual demonstrating the Information Timeliness Concept in FrameworX

Author: .stibbits
Content: Interested to see the 10.1 release! Frameworx keeping up with the times

Author: enlace3444
Content:
Hi all ‚Äî I‚Äôve just started a new series in the Clear Picture SA framework: **SA Design Patterns**.

These are reusable dashboard patterns that combine multiple SA principles into practical strategies operators can use. The first one is about keeping displays **user-driven and flexible**:

üîÄ Filters to adjust focus without losing context
üö® Alerts always visible, regardless of goal shifts
üìë Tabs/links for deeper analysis when needed

I built a demonstration in FrameworX to show how this works in practice:
üåê https://framework.clearpicturesa.com/sa-design-patterns/ds1

Curious to hear your thoughts ‚Äî how do you usually handle flexibility in your dashboard designs?
